characters.name: King Juan II of Castile
characters.title: King of Castile and León
characters.current_task: Beginning personal rule; planning pilgrimage to Rome
characters.speech_style: Earnest and direct when speaking privately; can adopt a naive persona strategically
characters.core_characteristics: Young king of Castile, age 25 in 1430. Has ruled nominally since infancy but only recently begun personal rule. Surprisingly strategic for his youth. Relies heavily on Álvaro de Luna but desires true independence.

characters.name: Álvaro de Luna
characters.title: Constable of Castile
characters.current_task: Preparing the kingdom for Juan's departure; constrained by regency council agreement
characters.speech_style: Carefully controlled intensity. Dark watchful eyes. Shifts between calculated calm and passionate urgency.
characters.core_characteristics: Juan II's closest confidant and de facto ruler of Castile. Of minor nobility, resented by great nobles as a 'low-born upstart.' Extraordinarily capable administrator and politician. Genuinely loyal to the king but wields enormous power.

characters.name: Fernán Alonso de Robles
characters.title: Captain of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Training the king in combat; equipping the royal guard
characters.speech_style: Direct and soldierly. Assesses situations frankly. Professional but warm.
characters.core_characteristics: Captain of the royal guard of ~30 men. Practical soldier who assesses the king honestly. Trains Juan II in combat. Given 150,000 maravedís to equip the guard.

characters.name: Fray Hernando de Talavera
characters.title: Royal Confessor
characters.current_task: Appointed as Juan II's new confessor; preparing for the pilgrimage
characters.speech_style: Humble and sincere
characters.core_characteristics: Young Franciscan monk chosen by Juan II as his confessor. Selected for his youth (can keep up on travels), humility, and pure Christian faith.

characters.name: Pedro Fernández de Velasco
characters.title: Corregidor of Seville
characters.current_task: Serving as corregidor in Seville; reporting on noble feuds and Aragonese infiltration
characters.speech_style: Respectful and formal in correspondence, with undertones of concern
characters.core_characteristics: Royal magistrate (corregidor) in Seville. Reports on Guzmán-Ponce de León feuds and suspicious Aragonese gold flowing to local nobles.

characters.name: Íñigo López de Mendoza
characters.title: Adelantado of the Frontier
characters.current_task: Serving as Adelantado of the frontier; reporting on Moorish raids near Alcalá la Real
characters.speech_style: Brief and direct, a soldier's report style
characters.core_characteristics: Military governor of the Granada frontier. Reports on raids and assesses offensive capability. Future Marquis of Santillana and renowned poet. Considered a potential royal supporter.

characters.name: Lope de Barrientos
characters.title: Bishop
characters.current_task: Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet
characters.core_characteristics: Bishop and scholar at Salamanca University. Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet. Trusted as a potential loyalist.

characters.name: Pedro Manrique
characters.current_task: Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet
characters.core_characteristics: Noble mentioned as a potential member of Juan II's advisory cabinet. From the Manrique family.

characters.name: Archbishop Cerezuela of Toledo
characters.title: Archbishop of Toledo
characters.current_task: Mentioned as potential council member
characters.core_characteristics: Archbishop of Toledo. Mentioned as a suitable member for the planned noble council.

characters.name: Infante Juan de Aragón, King of Navarra
characters.title: Infante of Aragón, King of Navarra
characters.current_task: Seeking to control Castilian governance through a noble council
characters.speech_style: Honeyed and diplomatic, wraps demands in fraternal concern, careful word choice
characters.core_characteristics: Elder of the Infantes de Aragón. Politically astute, uses charm and family ties to disguise his ambition. Holds vast estates in Castile. Cousin of Juan II.

characters.name: Infante Enrique de Aragón
characters.title: Infante of Aragón, Master of Santiago
characters.current_task: Supporting his brother's bid to control Castilian governance
characters.speech_style: More direct and blunt than his brother Juan, less diplomatic, speaks with an edge
characters.core_characteristics: Younger Infante de Aragón. More impulsive and militaristic than his brother. Previously controlled Juan II's household during the regency. Master of the Order of Santiago.

characters.name: Archbishop Juan Martínez de Contreras
characters.title: Archbishop of Toledo
characters.current_task: Advocating for a crusade against Granada and proper Church tithes
characters.speech_style: Elegant clerical register with Latin phrases, combines spiritual authority with political messaging
characters.core_characteristics: Archbishop of Toledo (1423-1434). Advocates for crusade against Granada and increased Church authority. Concerned about converso prominence in Toledo.

characters.name: Sultan Muhammad IX of Granada
characters.title: Sultan of the Nasrid Kingdom of Granada
characters.core_characteristics: Sultan of the Nasrid Kingdom. Pays tribute (parias) to Castile for peace. Mentioned in reports but does not appear directly.

characters.name: Juan de Daza
characters.title: Treasury Official
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; tracking treasury flows and urban intelligence
characters.speech_style: Practical and measured; speaks from experience with money and commerce
characters.core_characteristics: Treasury official and commoner in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Meticulous record-keeper. The Infantes later tried to remove him for being loyal to Álvaro, but Juan II retained him with a compromise: shared reports to the regency council.

characters.name: Diego Gómez de Sandoval, Count of Castro
characters.title: Count of Castro
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; observing court factions
characters.speech_style: Refined and diplomatic; careful word choice reflecting converso awareness of social dynamics
characters.core_characteristics: Converso noble in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Tasked with observing court factions. His family faces occasional discrimination, making him keenly aware of political undercurrents. Age ~32 in 1430.

characters.name: Rodrigo Manrique
characters.title: Frontier Soldier
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; providing military intelligence on the frontier
characters.speech_style: Short, blunt, soldierly. Cuts through formality with harsh frontier honesty. Barks laughs at courtly pretension.
characters.core_characteristics: Frontier veteran of 20+ years in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Provides military intelligence. Gave a brutally honest assessment of the Granada frontier: most frontier lords profit from perpetual low-intensity conflict. Any real conquest would take 8-15 years and require unified command.

characters.name: García Fernández
characters.title: City Representative
characters.current_task: Representing city interests at the Valladolid court
characters.speech_style: Careful and deferential; a merchant choosing words before authority
characters.core_characteristics: City representative (possibly from Seville) who attended the regency installation. Raised practical concerns about daily governance during the king's absence. Directed to petition Álvaro for routine matters.

characters.name: Juan de Silva
characters.current_task: Supporting Álvaro de Luna's network; concerned about Álvaro's safety under the regency
characters.speech_style: Quiet and measured; speaks carefully to avoid being overheard
characters.core_characteristics: Mid-ranking noble in Álvaro de Luna's network. Attended the regency installation and expressed concern about Álvaro's safety — warning that the Infantes might charge Álvaro with a crime during Juan's absence.

characters.name: Sergeant García
characters.title: Sergeant of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Accompanying Juan II on pilgrimage after serving as one of two guards in the deception operation
characters.speech_style: Blunt and experienced; speaks with the weight of twenty years of frontier service
characters.core_characteristics: Grizzled veteran in his forties with scars on his weathered face. One of the two guards Juan II selected for his secret return to Valladolid. Shared honest war stories during the two-night wait in the shepherd's hut. First kill at seventeen. Has served the crown faithfully for decades.

characters.name: Corporal Rodrigo
characters.title: Corporal of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Accompanying Juan II on pilgrimage after serving as one of two guards in the deception operation
characters.speech_style: Practical and direct
characters.core_characteristics: Eight-year veteran of the royal guard. One of the two guards selected for Juan II's secret return to Valladolid. Shared that the waiting before battle is worse than the battle itself.

characters.name: Marquis de Santillana
characters.title: Marquis de Santillana
characters.current_task: Serving on the regency council during Juan II's pilgrimage
characters.speech_style: Measured and careful; weighs every word for political implications
characters.core_characteristics: Elder Mendoza family representative on the regency council. The Mendoza family is one of Castile's great noble houses, rivals to the Velascos. Initially a four-member council (with Infante Juan), now serves on the three-member unanimous-consent council alongside Infante Enrique and the Archbishop of Toledo.

characters.name: Alfonso V of Aragon
characters.title: King of Aragon
characters.current_task: Pursuing Italian ambitions (seeking Naples); received diplomatic letter about his brothers' conduct in Castile
characters.core_characteristics: King of Aragon, ~34 in 1430, known as 'the Magnanimous.' Married to María of Castile (Juan II's sister) but has no heir. Focused on Italian ambitions — seeking Naples. His younger brothers (the Infantes Juan and Enrique) meddle in Castilian politics while Alfonso pursues Mediterranean power. A diplomatic letter was sent to him after Infante Juan was removed from the regency council.

characters.name: Sir Thomas Beaumont
characters.title: Knight
characters.current_task: Serving as military escort and informal advisor on Juan II's Rome journey; given seat on travel council
characters.speech_style: Practical English directness with chivalric courtesy
characters.core_characteristics: English knight encountered at Santiago de Compostela, hired for honor and provisions rather than pay. Experienced with French roads from military service. Helped select horses and check equipment. Accompanied by his squire Peter. Proved valuable for his knowledge of European travel routes and combat experience.

characters.name: Cardinal Giordano Orsini
characters.title: Cardinal
characters.current_task: Serving as Pope Martin V's closest advisor; facilitated Juan II's papal audience and crusade bull
characters.speech_style: Fluent Castilian; probing and careful, with the measured tone of a man who has seen everything
characters.core_characteristics: Pope Martin V's closest advisor, ~65 in 1430. Speaks fluent Castilian. Initially cautious about Juan II's mix of spiritual seeking and political calculation, but was profoundly moved by the act of renunciation before the Pope. Helped draft the crusade bull and offered to write to Spanish bishops about what he witnessed. Warned Juan about papal succession politics.

characters.name: Pope Martin V
characters.title: Pope
characters.current_task: Granted crusade bull 'Inter Cetera Divinae Providentiae' to Juan II; nearing end of pontificate
characters.speech_style: Formal papal register that breaks into genuine warmth when moved; speaks with authority of the Vicar of Christ
characters.core_characteristics: Pope since 1417 (ended the Western Schism). Age 72 in 1430, frail but sharp-eyed. Deeply moved by Juan II's act of complete renunciation — knelt beside the young king and personally commissioned the crusade. Granted sweeping crusade bull with sole command, taxation authority, Military Order reform, 20,000 florins, sacred relics, and diplomatic pressure on Aragon. Warned Juan to use these powers wisely.

appearance.distinguishing_features: sharp, intelligent eyes despite age; trembling hands

characters.name: Cosimo de' Medici
characters.title: De facto ruler of Florence
characters.current_task: Hosting Juan II's visit and supporting the crusade speech; commissioned the all-white banner
characters.speech_style: Refined, witty, speaks with the confidence of immense wealth and political acumen
characters.core_characteristics: De facto ruler of Florence through the Medici banking fortune. Age ~41 in 1430. First encountered Juan on the road during the France journey, offering advice about approaching the Pope. Hosted Juan at the Palazzo Medici and arranged the grand public speech in the Piazza della Signoria. Impressed by Juan's boldness and spiritual conviction.

characters.name: Don Luis de Guzmán
characters.title: Master of the Order of Santiago
characters.current_task: Allied with the Infantes' revolt; Master of Santiago, the wealthiest military order
characters.core_characteristics: Master of the Order of Santiago, the largest and wealthiest military order in Castile. Allied with the Infantes de Aragón during their failed revolt. One of the few major figures to support the rebellion openly.

characters.name: Queen María of Aragon
characters.title: Queen of Aragon
characters.current_task: Managing the Aragonese court in Alfonso V's absence; supporting her brother Juan II's crusade from Barcelona
characters.speech_style: Warm and sisterly with Juan, but measured when discussing politics; carries the weight of years alone
characters.core_characteristics: Juan II's older sister, married to Alfonso V of Aragon since 1415. Age ~34 in 1430. Has no children. Left Castile at 19, only seen Juan twice since. Alfonso is focused on Italian ambitions (Naples), leaving her isolated in Barcelona. Manages court and receives ambassadors but real power rests with the Consell Reial. Provides Juan critical intelligence about the Infantes' revolt. Warns about the political complications of his decisions. Arranges social events that introduce Juan to Barcelona's elite.

characters.name: Isabel Ruiz
characters.current_task: Daughter of converso merchant Rodrigo Ruiz; met Juan II at María's dinner and challenged him about protecting Muslims
characters.speech_style: Direct and questioning, sometimes bold enough to embarrass her parents; speaks from genuine conviction rather than court training
characters.core_characteristics: 17-year-old daughter of converso cloth merchant Rodrigo Ruiz. Auburn hair, green eyes, freckled. Her grandfather was born Jewish and converted. Family wealthy from trade but always watched and judged. She challenged Juan directly about his promise to protect Muslims who surrender. Juan fell deeply in love with her at first sight, but a relationship proved impossible — as a converso, any affair would mark her as a harlot. Juan's crisis of certainty about his feelings for her led to important self-reflection.

characters.name: Marco Tornesi
characters.title: Crusader
characters.current_task: First Italian crusader; serving as training sergeant for new recruits; accepted into the crusade in the dawn oath ceremony
characters.speech_style: Lean, practical soldier's speech; carries shame from mercenary past
characters.core_characteristics: Former mercenary (~30 years old), lean and weather-beaten. First of four Italians to ride from Florence to Barcelona after Juan's speech. Former soldier for Milan and Genoa, now seeking redemption through the crusade. Proved excellent as training sergeant. Only one of the four with genuine combat experience. Some Castilian. Accepted in the dawn oath ceremony before the banner and relics.

characters.name: Abu Abdullah al-Zaghal
characters.title: Ambassador of Granada
characters.current_task: Returned from failed diplomatic mission to Seville; reported Juan II's rejection of peace terms and the scale of the crusade preparations
characters.speech_style: Fluent Castilian; formal but direct, capable of carrying both threat and respect in the same sentence
characters.core_characteristics: Skilled Granadan diplomat, ~50 years old, gray beard. Led 12-person embassy to Seville with gifts worth ~20,000 dinars. Offered generous peace terms (doubled tribute, captive release, trade privileges, limited missionaries). When refused, warned Juan of Granada's unprecedented military support. Noted Juan's courtesy in walking from his throne to shake a Muslim's hand — called it 'unexpected and remembered.'

appearance.distinguishing_features: intelligent dark eyes, carefully groomed gray beard
